basic_data.name: Toronto Travellers Home
basic_data.priceRange: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

reviews.title: Never more
reviews.text: Too expensive for a place that has not been improved for many years. The staff is good, very nice, but it is not in their hands to make the improvements that the hostel needs. The Chinese owner has several buildings, he receives a lot of money every day, but he doesn't invest anything, he just gets rich without offering a good service. The place is deplorable, cramped, and uncomfortable. It is well located in Chinatown, close to Kensington market, but offers no other advantages. If you arrive late at night, there is no one there to wait for you.  The walls are made of cardboard, you can hear everything that happens in other rooms. Towels and sheets are not changed during the whole stay.

reviews.title: Not as bad as expected.
reviews.text: I was extremely worried after reading previous reviews but it wasn't terrible. You get what you pay for and this is ultimate budget. We were moved to the sister hostel at Williston Square. We booked two separate rooms and it was all a bit bizarre. Our room had a huge industrial sink in the middle and a fridge.  My brother's room had a microwave. The worst thing is that the rooms are boiling hot. Our shower didn't work but was fixed as soon as we reported it.

reviews.title: OMG!!
reviews.text: We made a world journey and stayed in different hostels all over the world. and this was, by far, the worst hostel we stayed in. We wouldn't go here again and advise you to take a look elsewhere. It's a cheap option, but then not even worth the money. They need to clean-up bad. Our room was in a basement and we couldn't even stand up staight. Terrible.

reviews.title: Don't eleven think about it!
reviews.text: Real Simple.The picture on the ex website or any other site is wrong. What you get is a  dilapidated house, police cars on the street because of the drugs that are present in the area. Don't waste your money or time.I have never written such a negative review and we had to fight for our money back.

reviews.title: Don't
reviews.text: This is probably the worst "hotel" we have been on. It's noisy and it's definetely NOT clean. Our plan was to stay there for two nights but we couldn't stand it so we left after one night.The room was a bit dirty and one of the windows was being held open with a piece of wet wood and the window in the bathroom only existed half because there had to be room for the airconditioner. The rest of the window was being held close with a piece of wet cardboad with some sort of black moist on it. Also in the fridge there was some black moist spot.Just don't.

reviews.title: Clean and friendly
reviews.text: it's a good place to stay in toronto. nice location (chinatown), about 20 min walk to center. staff is very friendly and helpful, atmosphere in the hostel is really good. for a youth hostel it's not very cheap, but the place is clean and breakfast included, which is okay. if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs, room had poor sound insulation. rooms are quite small but funcionable. rooftop is awesome, great view.

reviews.title: You'll slip right in to the groove of this fun, affordable hostel
reviews.text: Would have gone five stars, but my mandatory slippers didn't fit. But like that the owners have an in with the Prime Minister. Decor was fun and unique - who knew bank envelopes had so many uses? Towels as tablecloths? Revolutionary. And don't get me started on the bike lock toilet paper holder. As a contortionist, I like that their bathrooms are designed to fit my body type. Would return.

reviews.title: good for short stays
reviews.text: I was in transit and checked in for a single night. I found the place pretty descent. But, for tourists who'd need to navigate in and out of the city, this place isn't centrally located. That said, the tariff was cheap, and the owner friendly, which doesn't leave much to complain about.

reviews.title: disaster
reviews.text: avarage location, bathroom and room were horribly small, if you are above 170cm you may find it difficult to take a shower :D, disastrous staff, the lady told us that we can pay $5 more if we want a room with a bathroom and a window, the thing was that the bathroom in the room didn't have a door :D fun fun fun :D so we had a room downstairs, somewhere in the basement ;D more fun :D avoid, maybe try looking for sth better :D

reviews.title: Great hostess with a nice place considering the price
reviews.text: We felt really welcome at this place, the hostess was a gem who took great care of us and helped us out with everything we asked for.Granted, the rooms are quite worn, the view is not so nice and they smear vaseline under the bed to ward off cockroaches, but it was very clean and beds were big and you could borrow slippers to avoid the cold floors. Much better than most places in big cities that I have stayed in that kept the same price class. The rooms had microwave and tv and the sheets were clean and whole. Nothing fancy, but a nice place to stay if you are looking for something cheap for a few nights. We were very satisfied.

reviews.title: Great Location, uhm thats about it..
reviews.text: I booked this location for 3 nights. I have to say that I’m not entirely upset at this place but wanted to clarify what you will be getting if you book this place. Having said that, I would also say that I would book it again but this time at an appropriate price as for what I paid, it was grossly not worth that price. I realize the market effects pricing based on supply and demand but if you contrast what they charged,  you will see hotels of much better standing in the same pricing category. Unfortunately for me I probably would have chose one of them instead if they were available at my time of booking.I saw the listing on bookings.com. It like most sites has a listing description, amenties reviews etc. There is a revolving banner of several reviews of the location. When I was booking, I read a few of these ads and they looked generally pretty good. What I didn’t do (which I wished I had done) was to actually go into the reviews section. I made the booking as I was in a bit of a rush. Later on I actually checked the reviews and found them quite disconcerting.  The bad reviews totally outnumbered the good reviews at a ratio of 4:1 and that revolving banner of reviews I feel was deceptive (even though I awknowledge its my fault for not delving deeper).The place turned out to be decent but not great. I’d give it a 6/10. I will not go into the description as its accurate for the most part. The location however was outstanding. Two other things I took issue with: the pictures show a  shower and wash basin , the room had no wash basin, no mirror, no sink. Their expectation was that you use a lower tap in the shower or a mop sink in the hall as your wash basin. So if you wear contact lenses, or make up or want to shave you better bring your own mirror. The other thing that irked me was that they list that they include air conditioning. My room had no air conditioning. Luckily, it was cool at night in Toronto and the fan they supplied did the job (even though the blades were loaded with dust). I’m not sure if its bookings.coms fault or the site owner but I think they mislead in some cases. They did offer to change rooms if I wanted but the next day it was cooler so I decided not to uproot and change.  The cleanliness wasn’t bad but could’ve been better. The shower wasn’t that clean, the fridge had food remnants (just a few crumbs), the walls weren’t that clean. The floors were good and that’s possibly because they tell you to take off your shoes.

reviews.title: Great location, good value for the price
reviews.text: We needed a cheap last minute room for an unexpected flight delay, and this one was a great find. Right on the edge of Chinatown and around the corner from Kensington, and close to decent enough public parking ($12 for 24 hours) and transport.The rooms are definitely no-frills, but comfortable with good basic amenities, and super squeaky clean. Justin and Mai (spelling?) were very friendly and helpful about things in the local area. We did have a couple of students with a loud friend, but they packed up and took her elsewhere around 12 am, and apologized for the noise.Pro tip: I did hear some other guests complaining a good bit about having to take their shoes off indoors. Folks, if you don't want to take your shoes off at the door, then don't stay in a place that has that clearly posted as a house rule. For the money you're paying for this location, it's just silly to whine about it.

reviews.title: The Last resort
reviews.text: I had no other choice in booking this place as most of the hotels where booked out.What a let down, no TV no AC, shower realy small if you get a private room. On my stay there a had bed bug bites never have I had this in my twenty years travelling.Something worried me I alway look for a he exits in a building the rear exits where blocked by rooms being rented out the other thing that worried me was no green lights on the smoke detectors and no flashing red light so if a fire was to happen anyone above the second floor would have a problem.Don't sit on the seats on the front porch for more than 5 minutes or you will be told to move.In the twenty years I have been travelling this is the worst place I have stay, over price and not very nice.

reviews.title: Don't Stay Here!!
reviews.text: We arrived and we where met by this woman yelling at us to take our shoes off.  She then told us we had to leave our bags in the hall way or pay extra for early check in.We asked to use the bathroom and we where met by other guests leaving and wishing us good luck because their stay was so bad!  The rooms where ok, we slept well but I would't advise going outside the hostel at night.  Lots of homeless people, not a nice neighborhood.  If you like basic and can afford to get ubers into Torronto then go for it, but I won't be staying again.

reviews.title: Fair Hostel for the price
reviews.text: If you have stayed in hostels with private rooms before, this one is average. The rooms are very small but have a table and chair. There are several outlets in each room which is helpful. The location is great, there is cheap parking available (C$12/day) that is very close. The staff was friendly and worked hard to keep it clean. There is coin laundry available. For the price you pay it is fair. They do provide towels, the wifi was fast and reliable throughout our stay. Each floor shares a bathroom.

reviews.title: It's Alright.
reviews.text: I stayed here a few years ago when I first visited Toronto. The staff was friendly although the hotel itself wasn't very appealing at all. However I was able to sleep well there without any major distractions. It is within walking distance of the rogers centre and the cn tower so the location is great.

reviews.title: Not good at all
reviews.text: If you want to live in a wardrobe like Harry Potter this is the place for you. Super tiny rooms like 4m2. Didn't feel comfortable at all in the basement there. Cleanliness was OK but is improbable. They try to avoid cleaning by having a shoes off rule for the whole house..

reviews.title: Basic, for backpackers
reviews.text: You have to take off your shoes if you go upstairs. Room with bathroom: shower & toilet, without washbassin. The shower not really clean, poor towels, a lot of dust in the room. Very little space.The rooms downstairs may be noisy: you can hear people coming in and going out, and the staff spending time in the corridor and talking.  Helpful staff but some of them don’t speak English (only Chinese).Free wifi.Good location, near to the city centre. A lot of Asian restaurants nearby.

reviews.title: Affordable no frills place to lay your head. This is hostel not a hotel.
reviews.text: My son and I stayed here 1 night b4 heading to buffalo airport just before march break it is a bit further from bus station than expected.When you go in expect to use the phone just outside the main door and call for the clerk to check you in.Our clerk was very friendly with us only took 10 min to arrive even with it being rush hour. Even though he was chinese he could speak quite good english he was very friendly with us  check in was easy with no problems. Please note You will have to take your shoes off when entering easiest thing is to put them in a bag which they provide and carry them to your room. They do this to avoid floors getting dirty with mud and grime.Our room was in basement to get there go take the main hall  to the back of the house and there is a decent set of stairs to take you down to the basement rooms.We had clean towels in our room.There is also water at front entrance that you can purchase for a 1.00 in which they use the honor system to pay for it.Another thing to note is that there are cameras in the main parts of the hostel, main hall and downstairs hall front entrance.I think this is a great thing that means my security is being taken care of.I will tell you the powder rooms in basement and the ceilings are low so watch your head and there is 2 of them down there plus a main bathroom with sink and shower.There is also a fridge,microwave and laundry facilities to use if you need them but you do have to pay for the washer and dryer..The room s are very small but if all you are doing is sleeping then it will work fine.I did find the rooms and other areas to be very clean so not sure why everyone is complaining.They are trying to upgrade this place to make it more updated like the other properties they have so you will have to be patient.If you are a simple low maintenance person who wants a cheap no frills stay then this will work for you. Best restaurant nearby is the village idiot pub must go there.I just booked another room at one of their other properties for Dec as we need to be a bit closer to bus station and it will be my 2nd stay at the other location.I didn't have a problem there with the check in process either. These places are close to everything, good restaurants, the greyhound bus station within min of walking, Tim's great chinese food a win win for us.One other thing to mention you will be asked to pay a security deposit of $100.00. for damages etc.This is common practice for most hostels/ motels / hotels.

reviews.title: Terrible, horrible, never coming back
reviews.text: As I tried to check-in, the receptionist pushed me towards the door because he said he wanted to make sure I had a reservation. When I asked him not to push me, he literally responded: "why so sensitive? Were you damaged as a little kid?"I don't think it's too much to ask not to be pushed by the hostel's personnel when you're a guest.The pictures on this site are absolutelly misleading.NO ONE should stay at this place.

reviews.title: Toronto summer backpacking
reviews.text: Me and my wife spent a few nights at travellers home during the summer, and the top qualities of the place are 1 - the location, near subway and public transport in general, and walking distance of the CN tower and the aquarium; 2 the the reasonable price and 3 - the friendliness of the owners and employees.

reviews.title: Absolutely disgraceful
reviews.text: Booked  through booking.com, arrived on time, 1230 midday, had to contact chinese guy who was rude and said we couldnt check in until 3pm. I said no we have the paper to say check in was at 1230. A guy came round, a tennant of the chinese guy, and he told us that people were still in our room, we asked to see what the rooms looked like and when we opened the door, the smell knocked us out, soiled mattress, dirty bed linen smell of body odour and feet. The whole building was falling to pieces. Needless to say we left. Parents, please dont let your children even go to this area. The pictures were really good, but in reality the place is truely disgusting.

reviews.title: No value, no effort in comfort
reviews.text: We stayed at the a Travellers Home in Chinatown, for one night. This historical home is located in a tree lined area, within walking distance to restaurants. You have to wait in the front room, ring the owner/manager to come and check you in. Waiting time is about 15/20 minutes. He didn't have much time for us, but told us to take our shoes off and leave on a rack near the front door, where anyone could take them. Our room, at the back of the house, had its own bathroom and toilet. The room was small, just enough room for two beds and makeshift furnishings. Little care was taken to make this room pleasant. No bin is provided, only a plastic bag hung up on the door. The toilet rolls are strung together on the door, that you can't reach when your on the toilet. There is no TV or air conditioning. The towels were scrappy and there was no hot water. The bed was rock hard, as were the pillows. This was a budget hotel, but more could be done to make it comfortable and pleasant. I wouldn't come here again. I got the impression this is a moneymaking venture with little concern for travellers.

reviews.title: More seedy impossible
reviews.text: First we couldn't find the place because it didn't had no signal or name outside. Then, when we came back at 3pm, there were nobody and we waited for more than 30min. And the rooms were awful. Too small to open our bag, and the washroom was so small than you couldn't close the door while you where inside it!!!

reviews.title: Great deal!
reviews.text: Great deal for the price, and friendly staff.  Small single person rooms with individual showers, bathroom, and air conditioner.  Located in funky neighborhood with great shops and venues.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Bizarre Bargain
reviews.text: This place turned out to be a really great stay. Comfortable beds and a great location walking distance from many attractions (China Town, Kensington Market, Yonge St, Rogers Center, etc.) and surrounded by TTC public transportation.We got off to a shaky start at this place. The initial entry is pretty confusing there are several pieces of electronic equipment (doorbell/intercom, dual security cameras, and a pig-tail corded telephone that emerges from below the front door) all with accompanying instructional labels (in English and Chinese characters) directing you to,"talk to us here." Advice: just keep ringing the doorbell until someone answers.Once you make it inside you must remove your shoes, and be prepared to haggle with the attendant. They initially told us that the room we had booked was already occupied, and that we would have to walk to a satellite location '5 minutes' away. DO NOT accept this outrageous proposition. After expressing discomfort, surprise, and intention to stay at another establishment if we were requires to go somewhere else, we were shown an available room (that appeared to be the same room we had seen pictured when originally booking online.Once you've worked out with them that you will be staying at the same address that you already made tour reservation at, don't be afraid to haggle for a lower price, they're willing to make a deal at this place.  Advice: ask to see the room before payment. You can use some of the room's bizarre characteristics to command a lower price. For example, the toilet in our room was so close to the opposite wall that you'd have a hard time fitting a paperback copy of "Of Mice and Men" between the wall and the lip of the lip of the bowl; sitting sideways was the only way to make it work. Also ask for toilet paper.After ironing out the terms this place turned out to be a really great launch/crash pad for visiting to city. Perfect of you plan on being in your room primarily for sleeping.

reviews.title: If you desperately need a bed for one night
reviews.text: My 2 friends and I needed a place to stay for the last 2 days of our trip and we went for the cheepest available - which was a mistake. Their check-in system is really weird: there is no staff in the hostel and you have to call them and wait for them. Then they drove us to another building where our room was (because they obviously have 3 different buildings around Toronto). We booked a room for 3 with a private bathroom and we got a dorm room with 5 beds with a "bathroom" - you couldn't close the door while sitting on the toilet because your legs were in the way. It wasn't exactly dirty, but since there is no staff it was not clean either. The location in the only ok thing - at least our building, don't know about the other two - we were in china town next to the Kensington market, which is practically in the centre. Avoid if possible, I wish we paid 3$ per night more and have a normal hostel.

reviews.title: Holiday Inn Downtown
reviews.text: This is the 10th & worst hotel we've stayed in - travelling by hire car east from Calgary to Halifax.Don,t be taken in by the fact it has 'Downtown' in its name. Tthe room is poor & a bit smelly. Food is ridiculously expensive.Also the people are nothing like as friendly as we have found them elsewhere.Luckily, only staying 2 nights to see the CN Tower.Then off to Ganacoque which I hope will be as good as the rest of the Canadian towns & cities we've stayed at.Canada needs to do something about Toronto! It lets the country down.

reviews.title: Terrible!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in March/April 2012, when we arrived the lady tried to over charge us and we had to show our email confirmation to prove how much we should have to pay. Then we were told we would not be staying in the hostel but in other accommodation which was accross the road. The accomodation here seemed like student flats. We were shown to our room which did not have a TV, but did have a cooker in it. The bathroom was covered in hairs and we only were given half a roll of toilet roll. The next morning we told the staff we did not have a TV, which is something they advertise all rooms have, we were told this would be sorted out that day. Everytime we passed the owner we were told it would be sorted soon. Then at 10.30pm we got  knock on the door saying they could not sort a TV for that room and we would have to move. The new room was cold and again had hairs everywhere. This room had no cooking facilities so we were unable to cook ourselves any food. On our fourth night as we were going to bed we saw a mouse run across the floor. We have now left and are very glad we are not staying any longer. We usually stay in the cheapest place and are normally very happy with what we get, however this was not the case with Toronto Travellers Home. I would not reccommend staying here and would advise you to pay a little more for somewhere that is cleaner and mouse free.

reviews.title: Charmless pit!!!
reviews.text: Would not stay again.House looks trashy.It's in Chinatown,near transportation.It is very cramped.Narrow staircase.They gave me bunkbeds, Trash under bed. It squeaked everytime I moved!!Dirty window sills,event hough they claim how clean it is.The computer is nice to have in-room.But it never worked again,after first day.It was not easy to use the tiny,tiny kitchen.The host was friendly, initailly.You have to remove your shoes.The host understands only half of what is discussed.It was quiet ,too many floors ,and rooms for size of space,for real safety in an emergency.Good luck!!

reviews.title: What a crap, disgusting DIVE...do not stay here!!!!
reviews.text: What a tip!  This place is DISGUSTING!  Being regular travellers, we have never stayed in anything so dire!  We arrived at Toronto Aiport and were picked up by one of the employees of the hostel.  En route, the driver pulled over on the highway and told us that we would have to stay in a different hostel, 30 minutes outside the city centre.  We had little option but to take it.The "hostel" was situated on the campus of York University, with no amenities nearby.   Upon entering the building, the smell nearly knocked us out!  Upstairs, the bedding was smelly and dirty and "never changed", according to the proprietor.  We insisted that he change the sheets and duvet.  Under the bed were empty cans and chip packets and a condom.  What a hole!In the other room, there were no towels and the second bed was a mattress on the floor.   The bathroom was filthy, with hairs everywhere.  When we finally got some "clean" towels and bed linen, they were filled  with pubic hairs.  There was also no Wifi connection. The next morning, the driver arrived to bring us to the original accommodation in downtown Toronto...i.e. the Toronto Travellers Hostel.  First he tried to persuade us to stay on the campus for the additional nights, but we refused.  Upon arrival at the Travellers Home, we were shown to our rooms, which were connected and shared one bathroom (we booked 2 bathrooms for 2 rooms).  The floor was covered with hair, the bathroom was filthy and mould was growing all across the ceiling.  The rubbish bins in the hall were unemptied and the smell was unbearable.  When we complained to the driver, he informed us that the owner was unavailable and refused to offer a discount on the price.  He eventually gave us a measly $19 off our bill.  We felt very pressurised to pay.  When we asked for a receipt, he promised to give us one but never returned with it once he got the cash.  At this stage, our situation was so unbearable, we decided we had enough and left.  A cab driver told us later that this is one of the most dangerous areas in the city, renowned for drug dealing.  Stay here at your own peril but be warned...it's really really bad!!

reviews.title: PLEASE READ. THIS PLACE IS AN ACTUAL SCAM. Do not get scammed by these criminals!!!!
reviews.text: booked this place through Expedia (who are a joke btw do not recommend) for two nights for me and my son (we were in Toronto for an NBA game).We got there at 7pm - checked in (I prepaid on Expedia).First off, it doesn’t look anything like the images on Expedia. Windows are smashed, the whole placed is tagged with graffiti, a woman inside was screaming help me by herself in the hall. Another man opened his curtains and started filming us. Ugh.We quickly ran out because we were about to miss our game at 7:30.After the game, we go back and the lady who checked us in has our door padlocked and says I owe her the full amount. Which has been paid!Oh, my phone died at the game because I didn’t have time to charge it (our flight was delayed and it was a whole thing).So I said I’d grab my charger, charge my phone, and then I could clear the whole thing up and pay her whatever I owe her.She refused. I tried to reason with her but she wouldn’t budge. My kid’s phone is at 3%.I called the cops.She came outside where we were waiting and asks for the key. I said that I’d go with her to the room - where she will get me my stuff and I will return her key.She says no. We got into a big screaming match about it. She doesn’t have another key and is losing it about how I won’t give her the key. Our passports are in that room!! Along with literally everything I have with me, I didn’t even bring my credit card or ID to the game. We’d just got back to Canada from overseas. So I told her that the cops were coming. She ran off then. Just effed right off. Never came back.All of this is while I am with my son!Cops come hours later. It’s after 1am. They end up getting the police Sargent involved because it’s just us standing there with no employees telling this weird story. The sarg manages to find a different employee eventually, gets the door open, gives us my stuff, and drive us to our next place.Oh. In the cop car, I overheard, “Yeah I suspect this is the same lady that owns the other 5. The woman from that time, ya know?”Cop shows me a mugshot on his phone, “is this her?”It’s her.“Hey, I didn’t show you that, ok?”*nod* 🤷‍♂️

reviews.title: Tolonto tlaverrels home
reviews.text: Undoubtedly the most unique place I have ever stayed at. The hotel as a whole was a very friendly place to be. We initially arrived to 588 Dundas (the room we payed for) and they told us that they had no room. So they sent us across Chinatown to 16 Willison drive. But for this I am thankful. 588 Dundas ave was the textbook definition of a dump and the clerk was an absolute dike. 16 Willison was definitely much more my speed and I’m glad that we got moved. In regard to the room itself there were countless selling points First off, The mouse traps set up definitely made me more secure about the rodent infestation. I was initially worried about the shower being too weak, but lucky for me it came through the faucet as well as the ceiling for all angles of coverage. The water did flood the bathroom, but let me tell you the flooding really did a number on the ant population. I also really appreciated the presence of pillows, sheets, and blankets. They may have been slick with oil but I wasn’t bothered by it. A huge perk of the room was listening to beating moth wings at night, the white noise put me right to sleep. I also found the room layout very curious, never have I ever ridden a toilet side saddle before or used a fridge as a trash can. Everything on the property was very clearly labeled. The number 16 painted on the outside at least a dozen times. If we needed to get to the front desk and the door was locked they provided 8 phone numbers to call.

reviews.title: interesting
reviews.text: They charge $30 a night if you call 718 614 7780. I overpaid online :-(. Overall rooms are small and no one speaks english. For $30 a night as a last resort it is a warm place to sleep. it beats sleeping outside.

reviews.title: Dirty and smelly. Nice location
reviews.text: Don't do it! unless you're really, really broke or a ginormous hippie - or both. I've travelled a lot, and I've stayed on tons of funky smelling couches and in many a cat-urine-reeking-commune in my time. I consider myself somewhat seasoned when it comes to cheap / bad accommodations. Therefor I thought that the negative reviews on this page where exaggerated - possibly written by travelers of the more preppy variety..However, they are not. This place is dirty and smelly. Toilet, bath and bed in the same (small) room. At least in the room in which I was staying. It's one of those places where you try to avoid touching anything. Which is hard when you have to sleep there. This feels like a parody of a hotel. Or maybe the antichrist of accommodations, haha. Great location though

reviews.title: China Town
reviews.text: A very basic and small room. In Chinatown around the corner from Kensington. I needed a place that was cheap and clean and it was both. Very nice man on staff and the owner was nice as well. Nothing fancy just a room and small bathroom to myself which was optional. No bugs and clean. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: NOT worth it!!!
reviews.text: Toronto accommodation is expensive, and having stayed in many a 1 star backpackers before, I decided to 'slum' it for $45 a night for a private room at Toronto Travellers Home. A price which is outrageous considering I ended up sleeping in a room which was no bigger than a cupboard AND also was the fire escape for the building. The only thing this place has going for it is the location, which is in Chinatown, a ten minute walk to downtown Toronto. There was no tourist information available, and the noise all through the night was terrible, mostly with rowdy Chinese people arrivng at 2am to have a row with the 'hostel owners'. This seemed to happen every night. For one night its fine, if you're prepared to put up with it, but any longer I would pay the extra money!!!

reviews.title: Horrible place in Toronto
reviews.text: This place is just between a favelas and a youth hostel. The room for 2 was so little, you cannot move. They were no lavabo to brush your teeth. The corridor are narrow, you cannot bring your suitcase. They give you sheet, but you have to install it. The lady who old the place wants you money, that's all. Even in all my travels in Asia, I haven't seen such a horrible place.

reviews.title: Worst experiece I have ever had
reviews.text: I booked this hotel via Expedia, arrived and was waiting 20 min to the host that eventually arrived, was extremely rude. We got single bed (without beddings, just mattress) instead of double bed that was promised, which of course wasnt suitable for a couple. I asked Jay to cancel he said ok (after we paid) and after I left he didnt text me back. I called expedia, they contacted him, and he told them he can just give 50% refund (which he didnt tell us when I was still there) and he lied and said there was a double bed and not single.

reviews.title: Nope, not this hotel
reviews.text: My recommendation is to choose another hotel in Toronto. We called Toronto Travelers home to ask for late check in and the person who answered the phone said it is okay. But apparently he didn't leave a note for the staff after his own shift and when we got there they already have given our room to another guest. They didn't offer us any other room in the hotel and we had to call a friend at 12 am and crash at her place
